intro: Notothixos spicatus, commonly known as the spiny bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, spiny leaves that help it anchor in muddy or sandy substrates. The plant produces tiny, white flowers with distinctive spurred petals, typical of its family. It is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and ditches. Notothixos spicatus is a carnivorous plant that traps small aquatic invertebrates using its bladder-like structures.
